intro: Diasperus ovalifolius, commonly known as the oval-leaved Diasperus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are often pink or red, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. It is relatively drought-tolerant, making it suitable for xeriscaping in arid regions.
